• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.

violation.

completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12409 Education policy
Section (1) An agency’s education policy shall ensure that, within 5 school
Description days of placement, an agency shall provide for the enrollment of
each child of school age, as defined by state law, into a school
program.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was not enrolled in school for almost two years while
agency had case management responsibility.
Investigation History of Youth A.
Youth A was placed into foster care October 23, 2019, with DHHS
Berrien County having full management responsibility. He was
placed in the home of Foster Care 1 on 3/12/20, in Harper Woods,
MI. Youth A, DOB 8/14/13 is a medically fragile youth with the
following diagnosis: Tuberous Sclerosis, Ash Leaf Spot,
Refractory Infantile Spasms, Localization-related Symptomatic,
Epilepsy and Epileptic Syndromes with Complex Partial Seizures,
Not Intractable, Without Status Epilepticus and Developmental
Delay. Youth A is not verbal, specific behaviors include being a
fall risk (he is tethered to the caregiver majority of the day),
unable to feed himself, food must be chopped into small pieces
otherwise he will cram food into his mouth and choke, does a lot
of spitting, has worn a helmet at one time to prevent spitting, will
attempt to stick his fingers in the caregiver’s mouth, wears
diapers, diapers must be checked often due to smearing/eating
fecal matter. Youth A runs, he does not walk, he is up many hours
of the night (which is why an assisted caregiver was assigned).
He is very unstable/unsteady and requires a lot of assistance to
walk, or he must be in a transport chair.
DHHS Supervisor/Complainant was interviewed via telephone
on 5/8/2023. She reported other than what was already reported,
she did not have that much more to add. She said she was rather
disheartened that Youth A had not been in school while in foster
care with assigned DHHS agency and that the assigned foster
care worker at the time did not seem to verify thoroughly with
Foster Parent 1 whether Youth A was actually enrolled in school.
2

Program Manager (PM) and Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was
interviewed via TEAMS on 5/16/2023. She reported that Youth A
was assigned to three foster care specialists (FCS), two who no
longer work for the department. She reported that her agency had
full responsibility for Youth A’s case from October 23, 2019, until
7/15/2022 when the case was transferred to a private agency. The
Program Manager said FCS 1 was assigned Youth A’s case from
10/23/19 – 10/16/20, she no longer works for the department.
FCS 2 was assigned Youth A’s case from 10/16/20 -12/7/20 and
she no longer works for the department. FCS 3 was assigned
Youth A’s case from 12/7/20 -7/15/2022 at which time Youth A
was transferred to a private agency. The Program Manager
reported she could only discuss the conversations she had with
the assigned workers at that time and refer to the social work
contacts during that time period regarding enrolling Youth A into
school. She said she reviewed 445 social work contacts which
were provided to this Consultant discussing school enrollment,
home schooling, numerous telephone calls to the Harper Woods
school district and conversations with Foster Parent 1. It was
noted in the social work contacts, and in the conversations with
Foster Parent 1 allegedly with the school district that nothing was
reviewed to indicate that Youth A was enrolled in school from the
time period of 10/23/2019 – 7/15/2022 while Berrien County
DHHS had full responsibility for Youth A. The Program Manager
said the FCS had some difficulties connecting with Harper Woods
Schools and she remember having FCS 1 call the school district in
front of her because she just did not believe a school district would
not answer the telephone. The Program Manager said she also
made a special request for the FCS to contact the school liaison at
that time, but she was not 100% sure where that led. The
Program Manager concluded that she could not find anything in
social works notes indicating that Youth A was ever enrolled in
school while in their care.
The Foster Care Supervisor agreed with what the Program
Manager said. She did not have any additional information to add.
Foster Care Specialist 4 was interviewed on 5/31/2023 via
telephone. She is the current foster care specialist (FCS) for
Youth A assigned to him from a private agency. She reported that
her agency was assigned Youth A’s case effective July 18, 2022.
She said Youth A’s foster parent, (Foster Parent 1) is assigned to
Midland/Gladwin DHHS and they have responsibility for FP 1’s
case. FCS 4 reported that Foster Parent 1 just recently had a
special investigation conducted by another government agency
regarding Youth A’s education issue. She said DCWL was
3

contacted due to information that was gained during their
investigation about Youth A not attending school while placed with
another DHHS agency. I think FCS 4 reported that when her
agency was assigned Youth A’s case, it was reported by Berrien
DHHS that Youth A was participating in the Harper Woods Virtual
Academy online program. She said she reached out to the school
district to confirm this information and discovered that Youth A had
never been enrolled in the Harper Woods School district. FCS 4
said she assisted in getting Youth A enrolled on 1/9/23 in the
Harper Woods School District. She said after his initial
Individualized Education Program (IEP) was completed Youth A
was placed in Detroit Public Schools for services due to his high
needs. She reported that Youth A receives 2 hours of educational
instruction each week which are completed on Wednesday
afternoons. A teacher goes into the home for Youth A’s schooling.
She said Youth A is supposed to receive physical therapy,
occupational therapy, and speech through his IEP, however due
to him not beginning home bound services until 05/13/2023, these
services will not start until next school year, they will be virtual,
and the time for each will be determined next school year.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Social work contacts- It was noted in the social work
contacts that the FCS’s with Berrien DHHS always inquired
about Youth A being enrolled in school and the foster
parent always responded that Youth A was being home
schooled, or that she was waiting on his previous school
paperwork which included his IEP and school records.
Finally, Foster Parent 1 reported that a teacher would be
coming to the home in the fall for the new school year.
Most of the social work contacts stated that Foster Parent 1
was home schooling Youth A. The information about Youth
A schooling was not followed up on by the assigned Berrien
DHHS foster care specialists in the social work contacts.
One social work contact stated that the worker contacted
Harper Woods School to inquire about getting Youth A
enrolled into school but wrote there was no answer, and
messages were left several times on the telephone, but
there was no return call back. It was also noted that Foster
Parent 1 was not comfortable during this time period as it
was the height of the COVID Pandemic to allow people to
enter into her home.
• Youth A’s current IEP Report from Harper Woods dated
March 2023. Youth A participated in testing and
assessments.
4

• DHHS recommendation regarding their findings on Foster
Parent 1’s home dated 5/17/2023. DHHS completed a
special evaluation regarding Foster Parent 1 failure to
enroll Youth A in school. The report states, “on 3/12/20 the
reasoning for not enrolling Youth A in school cannot be
determined. It is documented by DHHS foster care on
3/16/20 that Youth A was enrolled in Harper Woods virtual
school. Foster Parent 1 sent text messages documenting
her efforts to get Youth A in school. The director of Harper
Woods School special education program denied having
knowledge of Youth A until having contact with Youth A’s
current Foster Care Specialist 4. FCS 4 reported that she
has been working with Harper Woods School and Detroit
Public School Districts since October of 2022 to get Youth
A enrolled in school. The report continues by stating,
Foster Parent 1 could have done more to enroll Youth A in
some form of schooling, DHHS does not investigate
truancy or educational neglect. A predisposition
conference took place on 05/04/23. DHHS licensing worker
had no findings. Foster Care agreed that Youth A will
remain in his current placement.”
• Memorandum sent to this Consultant on 6/6/2023 by the
Program Manager acknowledging per policy that all foster
care youths are to be enrolled in school within five days of
placement.
Analysis In review of documentation, DHHS investigation report and
interviews with staff, Berrien County DHHS did not enroll Youth A
in school while having responsibility over his case from
10/23/2019 – 7/15/2022. CPA rule states that within 5 school
days of placement, an agency shall provide for the enrollment of
each child of school age.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Berrien County DHHS current license status be continued.
